item.title: Help with MSN Spammer
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Because you want to put it before you End the Case,
What you put in the case it expects to be a possible thing that (In this case)1+ Random(3) could be.
You don’t need to put another begin or end; in there.

[code]procedure LetusSPAM;
begin
Case 1+ Random(3)of
1: if(findcolor(x, y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2 ,MSY2)) then
SendKeys(‘Please Do Not Be Alarmed’+ chr(13)+ ‘This Is A Spam Fest’+ chr(13));

2: if(findcolor(x, y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2 ,MSY2)) then
     SendKeys('Please Be Alarmed'+ chr(13)+ 'I Am trying to restart your computer'+ chr(13));

3: if(findcolor(x,y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2)) then
     SendKeys('If you do not respond'+ chr(13)+  'I will spam you further'+ chr(13));

end;
Wait(1000+Random(1000))
end;[/code]
Would be sufficient

Read full topic

item.title: Help with MSN Spammer
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

ooo okay, probably a typo. Btw just a random question(because if I add the wait thingie it wouldn’t be a spammer). Why can’t I add

Wait(1000+Random(1000))

the line right after the cases without compiling errors eg.

3: if(findcolor(x,y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2)) then SendKeys('If you do not respond'+ chr(13)+ 'I will spam you further'+ chr(13)); //Why can't I add it here?
I can add it anywhere else without compiling errors.

Must I do it like this?

procedure LetusSPAM;
begin
  Case 1+ Random(3)of
    1: if(findcolor(x, y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2 ,MSY2)) then
         SendKeys('Please Do Not Be Alarmed'+ chr(13)+ 'This Is A Spam Fest'+ chr(13));

    2: if(findcolor(x, y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2 ,MSY2)) then
         SendKeys('Please Be Alarmed'+ chr(13)+ 'I Am trying to restart your computer'+ chr(13));

    3: if(findcolor(x,y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2)) then
         SendKeys('If you do not respond'+ chr(13)+  'I will spam you further'+ chr(13));
  end; 
  begin
      Wait(1000+Random(1000))
     end;
 end;

Read full topic

item.title: Help with MSN Spammer
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

[code][code]program LetsSpam;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

Var
x, y, mymark : integer;

procedure LetusSPAM;
begin
Case 1+ Random(3)of
1: if(findcolor(x, y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2 ,MSY2)) then
SendKeys(‘Please Do Not Be Alarmed’+ chr(13)+ ‘This Is A Spam Fest’+ chr(13));

2: if(findcolor(x, y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2 ,MSY2)) then
     SendKeys('Please Be Alarmed'+ chr(13)+ 'I Am trying to restart your computer'+ chr(13));

3: if(findcolor(x,y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2)) then
     SendKeys('If you do not respond'+ chr(13)+  'I will spam you further'+ chr(13));

end;
end;

Function Donotspamsomuch: boolean;
begin
if TimeFromMark(MyMark) > (1 * 500 * 1000)then
Result:= True;
end;

begin
SetupSRL
ActivateClient;
MarkTime(MyMark);
repeat
LetUsSpam;
Until (Donotspamsomuch);
end.[/code]
That won’t work because you call it in the same procedure, so It will mark the time every time it Until checks if it is True so it will keep resetting.
Also, Theres a ‘;’ after Begin so Wouldn’t that give an error too?[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with MSN Spammer
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Thanks for the help, but I got another problem.

Function Donotspamsomuch: boolean; begin MarkTime(MyMark); begin; if TimeFromMark(MyMark) > (1*5*1000)then begin Result:= True; end; end; end;

I added the start of MyMark, but then after I did that, and changed what you told me to do, it just ran for ever, without stopping. Help?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with MSN Spammer
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

until(Donotspamsomuch = true);

You had :=
Also, until(Donotspamsomuch);
Would work

Read full topic

item.title: Help with MSN Spammer
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

[code][code]program LetsSpam;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

Var
x, y, mymark : integer;

procedure LetusSPAM;
begin
Case 1+ Random(3)of
1: if(findcolor(x, y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2 ,MSY2)) then
SendKeys(‘Please Do Not Be Alarmed’+ chr(13)+ ‘This Is A Spam Fest’+ chr(13));

2: if(findcolor(x, y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2 ,MSY2)) then
     SendKeys('Please Be Alarmed'+ chr(13)+ 'I Am trying to restart your computer'+ chr(13));

3: if(findcolor(x,y, 16777215, MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2)) then
     SendKeys('If you do not respond'+ chr(13)+  'I will spam you further'+ chr(13));

end;
end;

Function Donotspamsomuch: boolean;
begin
if TimeFromMark(MyMark) > (1 * 500 * 1000)then
Result:= True;
end;

begin
SetupSRL
ActivateClient;
repeat
LetUsSpam;
Until (Donotspamsomuch:= true);
end.[/code]

The reason why it works is because, as you know, that if you try to type anything in an MSN window, it will automatically come out at the typing box. This is why no declaring of any boundary blah blah blah. The real problem is with this part:

until(Donotspamsomuch:= true);

SCAR says the code-boxed part needs a close round

)

but when I add one I get a whole load of problems.

Help? Btw, When I try to put in a

Wait(1000+ Random(500))

Below every case, I get another error. Help please?[/code]

Read full topic
